Header1: Welcome to the CORS Sample App
Header2: See how Docusign API support for Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) enables developers to build single-page applications that let users sign documents directly in a browser window.

Card1.Title: Send Insurance Card
Card1.Description: This scenario enables an insurance company employee to select a customer and send them an insurance card, which the customer can sign to acknowledge receipt.

Card2.Title: Know Your Customer
Card2.Description: For the finance industry: this scenario walks users through a wizard that enables them to take a photo and upload it for identification; they are then prompted to sign and verify the photo.

SecurityNotice: Security notice: Single-page applications, because they execute entirely within the user's web browser, cannot store a client secret and must use Implicit Grant authentication. For more guidance on securing your apps, see Single-page applications and CORS.

Modal.Title: Waiting for login
Modal.Description: You must log in with your Docusign developer account to use this sample app.

LogoutModalMessage: You are now logged out of the CORS Sample App. Be sure to log out of your Docusign developer account as well.
